meanings.definition: To have doubts or suspicions about something.
meanings.sent1: I misgive the weather forecast for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She misgives his intentions due to his secretive behavior.
meanings.sent3: The detective misgives the alibi provided by the suspect.
meanings.sent4: His constant lying misgives his credibility in the eyes of others.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds misgive a storm approaching.

meanings.definition: To give a feeling of doubt or suspicion.
meanings.sent1: The strange noise misgives a sense of unease in the old house.
meanings.sent2: His evasive answers misgive the truthfulness of his story.
meanings.sent3: The creaking floorboards misgive the presence of a ghost.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence misgives an impending danger lurking nearby.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious package misgives a feeling of apprehension.

meanings.sent1: She misgives about accepting the job offer.
meanings.sent2: He misgives before making a decision without all the facts.
meanings.sent3: The cat misgives before jumping onto the unfamiliar surface.
meanings.sent4: The student misgives about speaking in front of the class.
meanings.sent5: The athlete misgives at the starting line before the race begins.
